lines.content: - Used for writing repeated code snippets (various commands).
- Used for writing creative and personalised responses of Woof.
- Generally satisfactory with minor tweaks required to better fit what I had in mind.
- Great tool to enhance efficiency and productivity, especially for mundane tasks.
- Good at fitting into the personality of Woof.
- Not perfect as it gives highly irrelevant or misinterpreted codes at times.
- Used a variety of AI tools: DeepSeek, Claude, ChatGPT, etc.
- Typically troublesome to get the context right before even asking for the questions I have in mind.
- Copilot is much more preferred as it is integrated into the IDE.
- Helped me better understand how the code works.
- Especially for JavaFX, which I am completely unfamiliar with.
- Helped with refactoring and better adherence to OOP standards in Java.
- Generally good to use if there is a more massive/major problems.
- Not so much for minor issues.

woof.Woof is a helpful chatbot with features of a to-do list that can help you keep track of the things you need to do.
You can use different commands to add 3 types of tasks: Todos, Deadlines, and Events.
Save all the brain power as Wood will help you remember them!
For example, I have a deadline to submit my homework by 23rd March 2025.
You can use the `list` command to view all the tasks you have added.
You can also keep track of whether you have done the task or not by `mark` and `unmark` commands.
Don't want a task anymore? Simply `delete` it away!
Want to start fresh? Use the `clear` command to remove all tasks.
If you have many tasks, you can use the `find` command to search for tasks with a specific keyword!
Have fun organising your life with Woof! And if you need any help, just type `help` to see all the commands available.
